commit.message:
Merge branch 'important-fixes'

Configure 'vifminfo' in sample vifmrcs to store most of the things in
vifminfo by default (add missing histories and tabs).

Thanks to Christoph Schmidpeter.

Adjust heuristic for determining previewer type to allow use of %px and
%py with %pd without any implications.

Document how use of different preview macros affect classification of the
previewer.

Thanks to iambumblehead.

Fix colors sometimes (rarely) changing in seemingly random ways.
An old bug which was made to occur more often last summer and was
visible on Linux after :restart and almost all the time on Windows.

Fix some :jobs showing some already dead jobs as running.
The bug is an old one, but it was much made much worse by the last merge
with 100% CPU load.

Make one test less fragile.

Fix bash completion.

verification.payload:
tree 5029e86bcf78e05c56d43824372c3560cf982eec
parent 733b9c97ea6ee3c37d15b0c9abf8f811d09f0640
parent 2f8bfbf3a4447a9b0b7e09b2aea864643fd1fd8e
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711801429 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711801429 +0200

Merge branch 'important-fixes'

Configure 'vifminfo' in sample vifmrcs to store most of the things in
vifminfo by default (add missing histories and tabs).

Thanks to Christoph Schmidpeter.

Adjust heuristic for determining previewer type to allow use of %px and
%py with %pd without any implications.

Document how use of different preview macros affect classification of the
previewer.

Thanks to iambumblehead.

Fix colors sometimes (rarely) changing in seemingly random ways.
An old bug which was made to occur more often last summer and was
visible on Linux after :restart and almost all the time on Windows.

Fix some :jobs showing some already dead jobs as running.
The bug is an old one, but it was much made much worse by the last merge
with 100% CPU load.

Make one test less fragile.

Fix bash completion.

commit.message:
Drop even running jobs from error thread

We won't be able to read anything from such a job, so no need to have it
there.  This in fact was causing an excessive CPU load due to job not
being marked as finished as a result of another bug.

verification.payload:
tree 5029e86bcf78e05c56d43824372c3560cf982eec
parent 050f49eab040ae9b3787fde80f43f7842dc06f8f
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711797787 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711798239 +0200

Drop even running jobs from error thread

We won't be able to read anything from such a job, so no need to have it
there.  This in fact was causing an excessive CPU load due to job not
being marked as finished as a result of another bug.

commit.message:
Fix effectively infinite loop on waiting for a job

This happened when the job has exited right after printing an error.  In
this situation we're in a nested loop for the purpose of displaying a
message dialog which also calls into bg_check().  Because rip_children()
was called unconditionally and bg_jobs set to NULL during bg_check(), it
did rip the process, but couldn't record it leaving it in a permanent
"running" state with an error thread going crazy because select()
returning immediately but the job was not changing its state.

The issue was there for a long time (since rip_children() was introduced
as a replacement for SIGCHLD), but was hardly visible and it was commit
6e86c8f497f86ca1afaa7ae9c91bf29e2df09d04 which made it very obvious.

verification.payload:
tree 1f8cacf277f01ff7f10350f7d826617f0d57120d
parent 1e3252f623a812ec4d7a5d6562c8a3377cd45d26
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711797875 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711798228 +0200

Fix effectively infinite loop on waiting for a job

This happened when the job has exited right after printing an error.  In
this situation we're in a nested loop for the purpose of displaying a
message dialog which also calls into bg_check().  Because rip_children()
was called unconditionally and bg_jobs set to NULL during bg_check(), it
did rip the process, but couldn't record it leaving it in a permanent
"running" state with an error thread going crazy because select()
returning immediately but the job was not changing its state.

The issue was there for a long time (since rip_children() was introduced
as a replacement for SIGCHLD), but was hardly visible and it was commit
6e86c8f497f86ca1afaa7ae9c91bf29e2df09d04 which made it very obvious.

commit.message:
Revert "Compact set of used color pairs on full redraw"

This reverts commit 1e413bcc2b736655523adfedc567f869a9c38361.

This commit was not necessary, it effectively tried to work around a bug
in how color pairs are compacted, but ended up triggering the bug more
often and prompting a fix.  There should be no need for this change.

verification.payload:
tree d3ca5de57c4be7621ca9f737e0e972ed45c76506
parent c113ad3a107b395849166045c81bcf54ddde8aa7
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711630414 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711630414 +0200

Revert "Compact set of used color pairs on full redraw"

This reverts commit 1e413bcc2b736655523adfedc567f869a9c38361.

This commit was not necessary, it effectively tried to work around a bug
in how color pairs are compacted, but ended up triggering the bug more
often and prompting a fix.  There should be no need for this change.

commit.message:
Fix colors rarely changing in almost random ways

Ever since color pair compression was added in commit
b396e661f85b36e9cd4664fe7b6da3e1f7fb2e0d, it was wrong.

Behaviour in tests and in the main code differed in one crucial way:
.move_pair() in tests simulated actually moving pair value while the
code assumed that the move has already been done and just take this
information into account.

This caused some color pairs to take on almost random value, but because
most remained as they should and also because this happens rarely, this
went unnoticed.

Recently, commit 1e413bcc2b736655523adfedc567f869a9c38361 was made
because this actually become visible when using chafa and such, but it
wasn't understood to be a sign of a bug.  While the commit was working
around this behaviour, it actually made it more apparent because now
every full redraw had a chance of triggering it (although :restart was
the most reliable way).

Actually move the pair before calling .move_pair().

verification.payload:
tree 2b1c6e1d8a6b31e8c5a457a86ec51f4ce94cb432
parent d4b18300133ab6dc208e5234b97d4b6a812493df
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711630019 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1711630019 +0200

Fix colors rarely changing in almost random ways

Ever since color pair compression was added in commit
b396e661f85b36e9cd4664fe7b6da3e1f7fb2e0d, it was wrong.

Behaviour in tests and in the main code differed in one crucial way:
.move_pair() in tests simulated actually moving pair value while the
code assumed that the move has already been done and just take this
information into account.

This caused some color pairs to take on almost random value, but because
most remained as they should and also because this happens rarely, this
went unnoticed.

Recently, commit 1e413bcc2b736655523adfedc567f869a9c38361 was made
because this actually become visible when using chafa and such, but it
wasn't understood to be a sign of a bug.  While the commit was working
around this behaviour, it actually made it more apparent because now
every full redraw had a chance of triggering it (although :restart was
the most reliable way).

Actually move the pair before calling .move_pair().

commit.message:
Fix unreliable misc/cmdline_completion test

autocd_completion test was relying on sandbox directory containing
menus/ subdirectory thus depending on that test suite being already
started.

In particular a fresh checkout would fail if only misc tests are run
which is no good.

verification.payload:
tree 8209693a64708ab8fbadd2c2d030c976934b7809
parent 3366ac73dda36a106dcaf696aad82b99684614cc
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710851585 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710851585 +0200

Fix unreliable misc/cmdline_completion test

autocd_completion test was relying on sandbox directory containing
menus/ subdirectory thus depending on that test suite being already
started.

In particular a fresh checkout would fail if only misc tests are run
which is no good.

commit.message:
Merge branch 'packer-plugin'

Fix stream redirection issues with background jobs on Windows (those
created via `:!cmd &` or in Lua) if the application was closing one of
standard streams.

Plugins
-------
* Make VifmJob:errors() wait for receiving errors if the job has
  finished.  This avoids empty errors after waiting for a job.
* Fix jobs created via vifm.startjob() being displayed with "UNKNOWN"
  for description on the job bar.
* Process onexit callback faster.
* pack & unpack: combine into packer
* packer: fix escaping issues
* packer: make it work on Windows
* packer: `:Pack` now accepts full name instead of extension
* packer: `:Unpack` can be run on selection
* packer: `:Unpack -b` could be used to unpack in background (make
          the default?)

verification.payload:
tree 8de9ea0d50f0e449ba1f5854c4f506839798e3f0
parent d48e6a6c91575db66fca402522fdfebb7b384dc3
parent ff953304cd9097af23dbee2feab710a4c273f655
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710179008 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710179008 +0200

Merge branch 'packer-plugin'

Fix stream redirection issues with background jobs on Windows (those
created via `:!cmd &` or in Lua) if the application was closing one of
standard streams.

Plugins
-------
* Make VifmJob:errors() wait for receiving errors if the job has
  finished.  This avoids empty errors after waiting for a job.
* Fix jobs created via vifm.startjob() being displayed with "UNKNOWN"
  for description on the job bar.
* Process onexit callback faster.
* pack & unpack: combine into packer
* packer: fix escaping issues
* packer: make it work on Windows
* packer: `:Pack` now accepts full name instead of extension
* packer: `:Unpack` can be run on selection
* packer: `:Unpack -b` could be used to unpack in background (make
          the default?)

commit.message:
Fix redirection issues of bg jobs on Windows

Whether created via `:!cmd &` or in Lua.

If the application was closing one of standard streams while using
another one (like `tar` seems to close input stream), this could cause
trouble because streams were the same (Windows doesn't duplicate
configured handles).

This also adds set of proper tests for such cases (all 8 possible
combinations of using/closing streams).

verification.payload:
tree 01e2847fbeec1d6404a9c317a911230034c9809f
parent 1d3d558f747bd234060940cfb12936b383ba4517
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710165502 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710178207 +0200

Fix redirection issues of bg jobs on Windows

Whether created via `:!cmd &` or in Lua.

If the application was closing one of standard streams while using
another one (like `tar` seems to close input stream), this could cause
trouble because streams were the same (Windows doesn't duplicate
configured handles).

This also adds set of proper tests for such cases (all 8 possible
combinations of using/closing streams).

error the command has printed.

also have other uses related to synchronization with error thread.

commit.message:
Improve closing of error pipe in launch_external()

It wasn't closed on failure to start the command and all other places
were missing check for INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE which is necessary because
error stream might not be redirected.  This is Windows-specific.

verification.payload:
tree f5e67cc8df39acc56521156409aed13b05c68aee
parent a1c5d350a5971216a3fb57d6fd10f29f0aa510c4
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1709632364 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710178207 +0200

Improve closing of error pipe in launch_external()

It wasn't closed on failure to start the command and all other places
were missing check for INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE which is necessary because
error stream might not be redirected.  This is Windows-specific.

commit.message:
Remove always true condition in launch_external()

startup.hStdInput can't be equal to INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE with current
code, the check is probably a leftover from some older version.

startup.hStdInput can't be equal to INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE with current
code, the check is probably a leftover from some older version.

were placed on a bar (which redraws UI) before the description was set.

Fix job bar displaying "UNKNOWN" for description

For jobs created via vifm.startjob().  Happened because external jobs
were placed on a bar (which redraws UI) before the description was set.

commit.message:
packer: fix unpacking with 7z

`match()` wasn't producing correct results for file names that include
symbols with special meaning in regular expressions.  index() could be
used instead, but file name starts at sixth field only for directories,
it's the fifth one for files, so just cut the line at fixed position.

verification.payload:
tree 97bcf7b3d351c390ee51a4869006fbb5699a7f57
parent 8e93a063ed02c7e4cf031208ca402ac55f94e8a7
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1709471062 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710178207 +0200

packer: fix unpacking with 7z

`match()` wasn't producing correct results for file names that include
symbols with special meaning in regular expressions.  index() could be
used instead, but file name starts at sixth field only for directories,
it's the fifth one for files, so just cut the line at fixed position.

commit.message:
Process Lua callbacks more often in event loop

This shortens the delay especially if callbacks start new jobs that
finish quickly.  Without this change such multi-stage tasks are
performed much quicker in foreground than in background.

verification.payload:
tree acb48dabc6ab3235c942df0b3d64718c9d925ad0
parent 3b3110ee09613143cdf606c3731d08e6eeb46c62
author xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1709315436 +0200
committer xaizek <xaizek@posteo.net> 1710178207 +0200

Process Lua callbacks more often in event loop

This shortens the delay especially if callbacks start new jobs that
finish quickly.  Without this change such multi-stage tasks are
performed much quicker in foreground than in background.
